conbody.p: A MERGE statement provides the ability to update, insert into, or delete from a keyspace based on the results of a join with another keyspace or subquery. It is possible to specify actions (insert, update, delete) on the keyspace based a match or no match in the join. Multiple actions can be specified in the same query.
conbody.codeblock: MERGE INTO keyspace-ref USING merge-source ON key-clause merge-actions [limit-clause] [returning-clause]
WHEN NOT MATCHED THEN INSERT expression [where-clause]
conbody.p: The following statement updates product based on orders.
conbody.codeblock: MERGE INTO product p USING orders o ON KEY o.productId WHEN MATCHED THEN UPDATE SET p.lastSaleDate = o.orderDate WHEN MATCHED THEN DELETE WHERE p.inventoryCount <= 0
conbody.p: The following statement merges two datasets containing employee information. It then updates all_empts on match with emps_deptb and inserts when there is no match.
conbody.codeblock: MERGE INTO all_empts a USING emps_deptb b ON KEY b.empId WHEN MATCHED THEN UPDATE SET a.depts = a.depts + 1 a.title = b.title || ", " || b.title WHEN NOT MATCHED THEN INSERT { "name": b.name, "title": b.title, "depts": b.depts, "empId": b.empId, "dob": b.dob }
